results.title: Top Screen 2006
results.brief_description:
Compile of 14 short films selected as the VCE Top Screen Season of Excellence 2006.
Two of the short films included in the compile are not licensed and therefore not available for screening:
“Blue sky, green grass, white clouds” and “Bad business”.

results.title: Top priority
results.brief_description: Set in an unspecified Third World country, this animated film, based on a short story by Enver Carim, suggests that “top priority” means different things to governments and to the governed. A drought-stricken family maintains a long and desperate vigil for a cloud of dust on the horizon signalling the arrival of irrigation pipes and pump. They are rewarded with a military convoy instead. Its top priority is a border war with a neighboring state, not pipes for the life-saving water the family must have.

results.title: Top of the world: taiga, tundra, ice-cap
results.brief_description: Shows the geographical characteristics and types of natural life to be found in the world’s three northern-most regions: Canada, Siberia and Alaska. Outlines the consequences of exploiting the areas resources.

results.title: Top Hat
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman, RKO Radio Pictures and Mark Sandrich
results.brief_description: One of the best musicals by the Fred Astaire-Ginger Rogers team. The featured songs are “Fancy Free”, sung and danced by Fred in his hotel suite as a way to bring him face to face with Ginger; “Isn’t this a lovely city?” which is sung and danced on a bandstand in a London park; “Top hat, white tie and tails” featuring Fred and the chorus in an exciting number; the unforgettable “Cheek to cheek”; and the lavishly staged finale, “The Piccolino”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pandro S. Berman, RKO Radio Pictures and Mark Sandrich

results.title: Top guns and toxic whales
results.creator_credit: Central TV, Better World Society, Television Trust for the Environment, Lawrence Moore and Robbie Stamp
results.brief_description: Anthony Hopkins narrates this documentary which explores the issue of environmental security, and the link between ecological crises and military expenditure. The conflict bewteen massive military expenditure and the human problems of population growth, energy source depletion, and third world debt is explored.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Central TV, Better World Society, Television Trust for the Environment, Lawrence Moore and Robbie Stamp

results.title: Top gun
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Tony Scott
results.brief_description: Directed by Tony Scott, “Top gun” was the film that catapulted Tom Cruise into mega stardom. Cruise plays Lieutenant Pete ‘Maverick’ Mitchell, a hotshot navy pilot, with no respect for rules, regulations or authority. Maverick is training at the Top Gun Naval Flying School, where he is out to prove himself to be the best of the best, at all costs. Maverick flies recklessly, but with skill, co-piloted by his best mate Nick ‘Goose’ Bradshaw (Anthony Edwards). Maverick is somewhat haunted by his father’s legacy, also a pilot, whose error whilst flying may have caused his own death and that of others. At the school Maverick encounters competition to be the top pilot from Lieutenant Tom ‘Iceman’ Kazanski (Val Kilmer) who mocks Maverick’s braggadocio and family history. Simultaneously Maverick is attracted to an instructor at the school, Charlie (Kelly McGillis) and is forced to face his personal demons in light of the strengthening feelings for her. “Top gun” features several daredevil flying scenes and has a sub-plot involving a run-in (mid-air) with some rogue Russian pilots. “Top gun” was the highest grossing film of 1986 in the United States. Also starring Tom Skerritt, as a flight instructor, and Meg Ryan as the Goose’s wife.

results.title: Top dog = Wodzirej [NTSC]
results.brief_description: Just how far will one person go to achieve their goal? For Danielak (Jerzy Stuhr), a variety host/entertainer, there appears to be no boundaries or limits out there which will stop him from being the MC of an upcoming gala ball in a brand new hotel. Danielak is prepared to lie, deceive, bribe and bluff his way through the chain of authority in order to eliminate his competition. Realistic in style, “Top dog” is a biting commentary on 70s communist Poland, and in particular, the bureaucratic State departments and State owned companies. Director Feliks Falk is representative of the 70s new Polish cinema, the “cinema of moral anxiety” and for this, if for no other reason, “Top dog” is both intriguing and entertaining. Cast also includes Slawa Kwasniewska, Wiktor Sadecki, Michal Tarkowski, Ewa Kolasinska, Ryszard Kotys, Jerzy Kryszak. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Top axe
results.creator_credit: Ray Barnes, Tasmanian State Film Unit and Rick Reynolds
results.brief_description: Discusses the techniques of woodchopping and shows some of the top international woodchop personalities competing in the world championship held at Ulverstone, Tasmania.
